author: James Tanner
method: Place the stock into a pan and bring to the boil. Add the broccoli, peas and chilli and boil until the broccoli and peas are just tender. Add the remaining ingredients, except the coriander, and simmer gently to warm through. To serve, pour the broth into a serving bowl and sprinkle over the chopped coriander.
ingredients: 300ml/Â½ pint hot fish stock (vegetarians can substitute vegetable stock),  3 stalks tenderstem broccoli,  2 tbsp fresh peas, or frozen peas, defrosted,  1 bird's-eye chilli, finely chopped,  2 tbsp sesame seeds,  2 tbsp cooked basmati rice ,  2 tsp soy sauce,  2 tsp sesame oil,  handful fresh coriander, chopped, to serve
